 and an active volcano in Alaska.
 
 Then I found this great USGS web site:
 Global Volcanism Program | Volcanic Activity Reports | SI / USGS Weekly Volcanic Activity Report |
 
 I hadn't heard about the caldera in Ca before but, I did know about the one in Yellowstone. And now the new activity around the Ring of Fire.

post_info.post_title: Re: Is the Earth Cracking Up?

sinjin
Seeing signs of the imminent end of the world is a sickness of the mind.
gansao

Seeing signs of the imminent end of the world is a sickness of the mind.

 
 Why?.........
sinjin

Why?.........
Because there is no objective evidence that such is the case.
gansao

Because there is no objective evidence that such is the case.

 
 Well some scientists seem to think that Yellowstone park is overdue to explode and kill us all , some others think that we are overdue for a hit from a comet and during the cold war many thought that a nuclear holocaust was imminent.
 In all these cases there was and is signs that a catastrophe could occur at any time but it is just a matter of when, not if.
 
 Some people look at the unprecented things that are happening today and see a very nasty end to mankind...
Sandycane

As evidenced by the "prophecy" here that could have been made by a blind orangutan.
 
 
 
 And? Good thing there's no evidence of increasing frequency then, I guess.emoticon_xbouncer
 
 We aren't having more quakes, we're just more and more widespread across the face of the earth.

 
 I think you're right about this.
 Mass media and the internet has made the earth incredibly small...50 or 100 years ago, no one in this country would have known, at the time, about an earthquake or tsunami happening in Indonesia or China.
 
 Famine, we can blame on a lack of self-control, over-population and mismanagement of natural resources... all preventable - if we wanted to.
sinjin

Some people look at the unprecented things that are happening today and see a very nasty end to mankind...
Which "unprecedented things"?
 
 Yellowstone has had eruptions. Comets have struck the Earth.
 Neither had a thing to do with mankind or his behavior.
COBHC

I don't believe in 2012 doomsday, but if you wait til the end of the world doesn't come in 2012 then write a book about the next doomsday on a certain date within the next 20 years with enough evidence to sound rational, you won't have to work for the rest of your life. Fear sells.
gansao

Which "unprecedented things"?
 
 Yellowstone has had eruptions. Comets have struck the Earth.
 Neither had a thing to do with mankind or his behavior.

 
 If you dont think that humans are going through unprecedented times then you must get out more.
 Apparently the last time Yellowstone went off, most humans died and as for the comet ..remember the dinosaurs.
 Some scientists think we are overdue for an exinction event ..without any reference to religion.
 Christians believe that Christ will return and some think this will follow catastrophic events such as earthquakes and global conflict.
 
 Global conflict is a modern phenomenom.
gansao

I don't believe in 2012 doomsday, but if you wait til the end of the world doesn't come in 2012 then write a book about the next doomsday on a certain date within the next 20 years with enough evidence to sound rational, you won't have to work for the rest of your life. Fear sells.

 
 Where does the 2012 doomsday come from?
Sandycane

I don't believe in 2012 doomsday, but if you wait til the end of the world doesn't come in 2012 then write a book about the next doomsday on a certain date within the next 20 years with enough evidence to sound rational, you won't have to work for the rest of your life. Fear sells.

 
 I think a 2012 doomsday - or, any day - is possible but, I don't live in fear because of it.
 First of all, I don't know any scientific facts that point to an immediate end of the world and if I did, I couldn't do one thing about it.
 
 And, if the movie scenario were to take place and there are some elites who know and are preparing for something like that to happen, I don't have one billion Euros to buy a ticket on the Ark. emoticon_cry
 
 I would like to think that if there is evidence that something like that is going to happen, there are people working out a Plan B for civilization...but, I doubt it.
COBHC

Where does the 2012 doomsday come from?

 
 Simple: someone will surely correlate all this volcanic and seismic activity to doomsday sooner or later. Wait and see. ;)
Sandycane

Where does the 2012 doomsday come from?

 
 The Mayans...or the movie.
gansao

I bet someone will correlate all this volcanic and seismic activity to doomsday. Wait and see. ;)

 
 I thought it was something to do with the ancient Mayas or Nostradamus..or both
COBHC

I think a 2012 doomsday - or, any day - is possible but, I don't live in fear because of it.
 First of all, I don't know any scientific facts that point to an immediate end of the world and if I did, I couldn't do one thing about it.
 
 And, if the movie scenario were to take place and there are some elites who know and are preparing for something like that to happen, I don't have one billion Euros to buy a ticket on the Ark. emoticon_cry
 
 I would like to think that if there is evidence that something like that is going to happen, there are people working out a Plan B for civilization...but, I doubt it.

 
 Someday the last living human will drop dead in a world of blistering heat, famine, and pain.
 
 The Doomsday List - Older Predictions
 The Doomsday List
 
 But I don't think that will be in the near future.
COBHC

I thought it was something to do with the ancient Mayas or Nostradamus..or both

 
 It does. Supposedly there's going to be some horrible tragedy in 2012, but what that tragedy will be depends on what "experts" say. And many of these "experts" are making massive amounts of money.
gansao

That's how it is now, but it could change any second; especially when we all live through 2012.

 
 If the world comes to an end in 2012 there will be a little part of me that wished I took a large loan out in 2011..until my screaming overcomes it:)
sinjin

If you dont think that humans are going through unprecedented times then you must get out more.
There's humans and then there's the Earth itself. 
 The Earth itself is in no threat from anything humans are "going through". 
 Even if we undo the entire ecosystem, the Earth will continue.
 
 
Apparently the last time Yellowstone went off, most humans died...
Most humans where? 
 The last Yellowstone supereruption was 640,000 yrs. ago.
 
 
...and as for the comet ..remember the dinosaurs.
Our ancestors survived that one.
 
 
Some scientists think we are overdue for an extinction event ..without any reference to religion.
Give or take a few million years? 
 
 
Christians believe that Christ will return and some think this will follow catastrophic events such as earthquakes and global conflict.
I know what they believe. There's no evidence that that time is near.
 Wishing it was is pathological.
 
 
Global conflict is a modern phenomenom.
There is no and has never been a "global conflict".
 
 Silly monkeys.
gansao

There's humans and then there's the Earth itself. 
 The Earth itself is in no threat from anything humans are "going through". 
 Even if we undo the entire ecosystem, the Earth will continue.
 
 Most humans where? Link?
 
 Our ancestors survived that one.
 
 Give or take a few million years? 
 
 I know what they believe. There's no evidence that that time is near.
 Wishing it was is pathological.
 
 There is no and has never been a "global conflict".
 
 Silly monkeys.

 
 When people refer to global catastrophes or earth shattering events they usually mean humans are involved...you know that and I know it.
 
 I saw a programme about yellowstone park and the catastrophic events for humans at the time on a television programme ..cant be bothered to find links.
 
 We may be overdue for a collision by a few millions years but NASA and the Russians are interested enough to be looking...once again cant be bothered with links..google it.
 
 Wishing for a catastrophic event is pathological suspecting one is about to happen is not.
 
 Once again..... WW2? and speak to the climate worriers , they will tell you a global conflict is very very near.
Sandycane

Someday the last living human will drop dead in a world of blistering heat, famine, and pain.
 
 But I don't think that will be in the near future.

 
 In truth, it could happen in our lifetime.
 Yellowstone caldera, they say, is overdue to erupt and although 640,000 years ago there weren't many humans in the US, today is a much different story: Massive death and destruction.
 
 If NASA were to detect an Earth-killing meteor, there isn't anything they could do (today) to stop it from impacting.
 
 On the other hand, if there is an urgent need to prepare for an imminent disaster, I don't think the general population would be told about it - some would take out massive loans. ;)
 
 I used to think that all the billions of $$ the government spent on space exploration was a huge waste and would be better spent on fixing this planet but, now I have a different opinion on that subject...especially if we have any concer for humanity's survival beyond our generation.
COBHC

My only concern is that people will take out huge loans at the end of 2011 and end up bankrupting themselves preparing for an event that won't even happen.
 
 The human race always fears global catastrophe.
Sandycane

My only concern is that people will take out huge loans at the end of 2011 and end up bankrupting themselves preparing for an event that won't even happen.
 
 The human race always fears global catastrophe.

 
 That alone would cause a catastrophe - of the 'unnatural' kind. emoticon_ic
